<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 13"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mail of Luck](/Equipment.aspx?ID=155)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 558 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Price** 2,600 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk** 3
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Armor** [Splint Mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=11)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This suit of _+2 resilient [splint mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=11)_ has a large, green gemstone inset in a prominent location.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You are hit or critically hit with an attack, but damage hasn’t been rolled yet;  **Effect** You force the attacker to reroll the attack roll and use the worse result. This effect has the [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) trait.

 Activating the armor causes the gemstone to turn gray and become inert. You cannot activate the armor again until the stone returns to its original green color. The gem turns green again after 1 week or when a significant foe critically succeeds at an attack roll targeting you. (If an enemy rolls a critical success at an attack against you and you force the attacker to reroll that critical success, that critical success does not recharge the mail of luck.) Even if the armor’s power returns before a week has elapsed, it can’t be activated more than once per day.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
